turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Jesus Christ.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Call Wydell.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Fuck, go to the car... call for backup. Tell 'em officer down.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Mr. Willis?

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: I'm Wydell... this is Naish.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Well, we were on our way out to run a check on a couple farmhouses out on the edge of town... closest thing we got to a lead at this point.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Well, all we know is the kids were headed out to a spot the locals call Deadwood to play Nancy Drew with some local legend about this character everybody calls Dr. Satan.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Dr. Satan?

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: What about the body you found?

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Oh, yeah, you know about that? Hmmm, that's a strange one.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Her part in this I can't figure... but I will.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Christ, you know it's crazy...  I lived through so many other people's nightmares, you know. Always cool and calm, but... but I never thought I'd be the one needing help, ya know?

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: I'm sure there's a logical explanation.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: I pray to God there is.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Well, let's go see if the nut that runs this place can help us.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Boss, the way I see it is these kids probally stop off somewhere, bought a bunch of booze and are off getting shitfaced.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: I hope you're right, but my guts are telling me different.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Your Spidey senses tingling.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Yeah...  ...huh, what the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: You know, your hyper sensitive Spidey senses... like Spider-man...  ...you know, like in the comics.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: How old do you think I am? I know who the fuck Spider-man is. Get to your point.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: You know, his senses start tingling... when he was approaching danger and shit.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: I always favored the Hulk.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Hulk was dumb as shit.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Aw, fuck.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: What.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Plates match.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Call the chief... We found 'em.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: You sure this guy's supposed to ride with us? Seems kind of weird.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Chief said pick him up and take him with us on our house to house. Guy's an ex-cop, thinks he can help.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Sounds like a bad idea to me, probally just get in the way.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Yeah, well I guess it's tough to sit on the sidelines and wait when your own kid's missing... besides, ain't no such thing as an ex-cop.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: I guess not.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: That must be him.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Yeah it's horseshit, just some boogieman crap that the kids like to scare each other with.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Anyway, there's not much else out that way... so, I figure maybe there's a chance the kids broke down and found their way over to one of the farms.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Don't worry, we'll find her.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Let's hit the road, sooner we get a move on sooner we'll find her.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: I'm gonna see if anybody's home. You and Mr. Willis take a look around the grounds for any sign of anything.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Right...  ...come on.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Wydell.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Excuse me for a second.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Over.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: We found one.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: And furthermore... Tell him, Harold.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Uh...  We must never act like apes, son. For you see, The ape is our closest biological relative -- specifically the pygmy chimp.  A single chromosome separates us. But you know what truly separates us from the apes, what makes us better than apes?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: That is the wrong fork, young man.  Harold, tell the boy.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: That is the wrong fork, young man.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Harold! Tell the boy again.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No "buts." Go to your room now.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: And think about what you've done.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Tell him, Harold.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Son, your mother and I are doing a production of The Gin Game at the local community theater. We forgot to take off our make-up.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Tell him, Harold.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: It's going famously, son, famously!

turns.speaker: FEMALE ROOMMATE
turns.text: Lila, what are you doing in there? I need to get ready for my date.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Nothing! I'll be out in a minute!

turns.speaker: FEMALE ROOMMATE
turns.text: I don't know why you didn't tell me about this.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: It's embarrassing, okay?

turns.speaker: FEMALE ROOMMATE
turns.text: It's not so bad.  So, it just keeps growing?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Yeah, Natalie. It's hair. It grows.

turns.speaker: FEMALE ROOMMATE
turns.text: Well, don't jump down my throat. I'm just trying to help.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: How is that helping, Natalie? How exactly?

turns.speaker: FEMALE ROOMMATE
turns.text: Look, if you're going to be like that... You should be appreciative that I'm interested.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Why, because I'm a freak and you are beautiful, and you are being nice enough to come down to my freak, nonbeautiful level and act concerned about my repulsive troubles?

turns.speaker: FEMALE ROOMMATE
turns.text: You're fucked up, Lila.  Why don't you fucking try electrolysis or something? Figure it out for chrissake.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Hello, my little boy.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Hey, ma. Did you bring any clothes? I'm freezing my ass off.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Oui. Nathan's silk suit, just like you asked.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Great.  God, I've wanted you forever.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Say my name.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Gabrielle.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You remind me so much of Nathan.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Like father, like son.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You remind me so much of Nathan plus so much of my little mongrel doggie.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Woof.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: As much as I loved Nathan, I'm not sorry she killed him, if it means I can have you. Is that a terrible thing to say, my sweet?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Hush. No, it is never terrible to be in love. Nathan's memory lives on in our sacred union.  I'm not sorry she killed him either. Nathan was wonderful. He was erudite and sophisticated and charming. You are all that, too. But you have something more. You have a bit of the animal in you.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Let's go eat, I'm starved.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: French?

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Oui.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Only three shocks. A chimp takes fifteen. This is going to be tres simple, no, Gabrielle?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Oui, doctor, oui.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Good morning...  We need a name for him, don't we?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Oui.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: You decide. Today is your day.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Really? My day? Well, I had a sweet little mongrel puppie named Puff when I was a girl. This one reminds me of my dog, all shaggy! So cute!  I loved my doggie very much, monsieur.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Puff it is then. Puff Bronfman. Is that okay?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Oui. Perfect!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Good morning, Puff Bronfman. I'm Dr. Bronfman and this is my assistant Gabrielle. We're your mommy and daddy while you are here.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Oh, Hi, Gabrielle.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Hi. I just wanted to tell you that I very much enjoy working with you.  Now I'm embarrassed that I say this.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: No. Don't be. I really enjoy hearing that. You're a terrific assistant.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Merci. I... Do you... would you like to go get a cup of coffee, perhaps?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Well, I don't know. I'm actually on my way to...

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Now I am truly embarrassed. Forgive me. I should not have asked such a stupid question. I know you are a very important man and...

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: No. Don't be silly. It's just...

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I am a foolish little thing. I am pink in my face, no? It is only that I have been so lonely lately and... I am ashamed. I'll see you tomorrow, okay? Unless... Am I fired now?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Thank you so much for accompanying me.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Not at all.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I have had such a difficult time in my personal life and you seem to be such a nice man... but I'm talking too much again, no?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Of course not.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You're so sweet. Oh, why are there not more men out there like you?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Listen, you're the best assistant I've ever had... Gabrielle.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I like it when you say my name. Is that stupid?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Oh, Doctor. I did not know. I'm sorry to disturb you. I just came for some papers I left.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Gabrielle. No, I'm sorry if I startled you. I came to think.  God, Did I hang up on you?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Oui. Perhaps I called at a bad time. I am sorry.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: No. I just got distracted. I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Is everything fine?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Oui.  Now you've got me talking French.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I was in my p.j.'s when I remembered I left some papers I need to go over.  See? I rushed right out of the house. I must look a mess. I'm so embarrassed.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I'm in my p.j.'s, too. Funny, huh?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Coincidence, yes?  And how is our son?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Our...? Oh!  He seems fine. I guess we woke him. The lights and all.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I should turn them off.  Maybe I sing him a lullaby my mama sang to me when I was a little girl.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: When you were a little French girl?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Oui.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: That would be good.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Shall we close up, then?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Maybe we should just sit for a while. It's very peaceful.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: It's nice, yes. I'm glad I ran into you, both in our silly pajamas. It is two happy coincidences, no?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Yes. Happy happy.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Yet you look so sad. A great man like you should not be sad.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I'm fine. Life is funny, that's all.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I am sleepy.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I shouldn't say this, but you're pretty, Gabrielle. It's unprofessional, I know.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Really? I always think myself so ugly. No, not ugly, but plain. A wallflower.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Really? No. Not at all. You're a very pretty girl. You should know that. You should be confident.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Thank you so much. Merci. It's very wonderful to hear a man say such a nice compliment.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: It's true. I wouldn't lie.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You are sweet.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: So soft. So smooth.  I'm sorry. It's just...

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Shh.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: What is wrong, my darling?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Nothing, my darling. All is right with the world.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Dr. Bronfman's line. Yes. One moment please.  Lila.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Shit.  Hi, honey.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Yeah. Okay. Be home around seven. Bye.  What? I'm sorry. What was I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I don't know, Nathan. What are you supposed to do?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: You don't abandon somebody because they have a physical problem.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Funny. I thought that's exactly what you did. You just don't have the courage to admit it to yourself.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Isn't Puff doing spectacularly, honey?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Hmmmph.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Gabby, what is it?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Hmmph. Hmmph.  Nathan, we have to talk, you and I.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Not in front of the boy.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: My little French.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Stop. Get away.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You have to choose Nathan. It's like Sophie's choice. Only it is Nathan's choice. Did you ever see that movie, Sophie's Choice? It is like that. Only it is this.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Gabby, you know I'm trying to sort things out.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: No! It is now that you must decide.  I love you, Doctor Nathan...  ...but I will not wait. I will not be your chippy. I will not be your little Mademoiselle Parlez-vous side dish.  My love. I want to have a sweet tiny baby inside my belly... from you.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I love you so much, Gabrielle.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: But?... But? There is a "but," Nathan.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: But I don't know how to leave Lila.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You were wonderful today, darling. Such authority with the ape-man boy. It made me so hot for you.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Unnhh.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: The way you are taming him, it sends chills down my girlish spine and... everywhere else, too.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Urgh.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Take me, darling! Tame your little monkey of love!

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Yeah? What?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Hi. It's Nathan.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Call you back.  You bastard! What do you want?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I just want to talk.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: We have nothing to say! You are a rotten bastard, that's what!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Please. Just one minute of your time.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Why? You've made your decision, Mister Stinky American! Now I hate you! No, I don't hate you; I don't even think about you!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I've got some things to tell you.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Well, I think it would be easier if I could talk to you in person.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Well, I think...

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You think too much. I need a man who doesn't think so much but acts more than he thinks... is what I need!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You heard me! You make me sick when you pretend to not understand what I am saying to you! Go away from here!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Well, look, I'm sorry to have bothered you.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: God, you're beautiful.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Please. I look a mess.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: No. You look so beautiful.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Anyway. Come already to the point.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I'm... I'm going to leave Lila. I can't stop thinking about you.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I've moved on.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: I've been seeing Johannsen in chemistry.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: That goddamn Neanderthal? I'm the one who gave him the idea for the combination bug spray-sun screen! Did you know that?!

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: That's not how he tells it.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Of course not, that Swedish thief! He's a thief of hearts!  I love you, Gabrielle.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Hunh.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Just give me some time to let Lila down easily. She's a really nice girl and I don't want to hurt her more than is necessary.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You hurt me, you know, when you made Nathan's Choice. Does that not even matter to you, you pig?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: You were wonderful!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Was I? I wasn't a tad stiff?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Don't be silly!  And you were wonderful, too! I loved the way you said " au revoir."

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: So we've got seventeen new bookings for speaking engagements, my wonderful men.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Terrific. We're all going to be rich and famous.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Lila?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: That's Lila?

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: A penny for your thoughts, mon cheri.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I don't know. Something's missing.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Yes, please, somebody ask him what is wrong.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I want our boy back.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Oui.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: That bitch. I worked so hard. We worked so hard, you and I. He would've made us famous.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: We still have you and I.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I know. And that's great. But it would be great in a better way, not a better way but a different way, if I could find him and bring him back.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Where do we look for little lost Puff?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I have some thoughts. I think that hairy bitch is somewhere trying to turn him back into an ape.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: That is horrible. Apes are dirty. No?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: You better believe they're dirty! And smelly! And messy! And they don't know their forks from their assholes!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I'm going alone. This could be dangerous.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Okay, my sweet. Good night.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: A little resistance would be nice, damn it.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Please let me go with you.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GABRIELLE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: My apologies, madam.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: It's okay, Puff.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Shan't happen again.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: It shan't happen again. I swear it. I'm just getting my sea legs, you know.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: It's an animal urge, Puff. It's nothing to be ashamed of.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: We're going back to nature, you and I. I'm going to retrain you. I'm going to make you free again if I have to kill you doing it.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: But I like being human now.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: I want to be the way I was before.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Good. I'll show you how, apey.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Nice night.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Talking is to be kept to a minimum. Eventually, when we are ready, there will be none. Language was invented so that people could lie to each other and to themselves. There is no other reason.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You'll thank me eventually, Puff. Well, you won't thank me, because we won't be speaking, but you'll sort of thank me with a special look, the look a dog gives you to let you know he loves you.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: What an enchanting picture you paint of our future together.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: He's dead.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: We bury the body. We disappear into the woods. Nobody knows.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: No. This is the end of the road. There's a dead human being here. For all of his faults, he was a human being, and certainly a victim of his culture as much as anybody.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Forget him, Lila. We'll disappear. We'll never talk about it again. We'll never talk again period. I love you.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Puff, what happened to you is as much my fault as Nathan's. Maybe more so, because I knew it was wrong and I went along with it anyway. I'm taking responsibility for the murder. I want you to go back to your old life.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: I won't let you do that. I shot the bastard. And I'm glad.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: No. Go back to the woods. This is a sacrifice I need to make. In my world we have something called penance. It's another abstraction, but I had the concept drummed into my head during my years in the convent. It doesn't exist for you, and it shouldn't. See, I could never be free again anyway, so I might as well be in jail.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: Then I'll live for both of us, Lila. I'll be the most free, truest animal in the whole forest. For both of us.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: That's what I'm counting on.

turns.speaker: PUFF
turns.text: But first I'll live among them, just long enough to testify before congress about the waywardness of humankind.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Okay. If you think it will help.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Progress!

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Ouch. Yeah?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh yes, honey. Getting to be smooth smooth smooth all over. Smooth as a baby's butt.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I love it, Rose. I'm getting to be a real girl.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You still in the market for a real boy?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Always. Ow.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Cause there's this guy. My brother knows him. Might be right up your alley.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Tell me. I could use someone up my alley.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I don't get that. Is that sexual?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Shut up and tell me.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Handsome, thirties, psychologist...

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Loves animals? Ouch. Must love animals, Rose.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Loves animals. Loves you.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Somehow it came up that you were a friend of mine. Mr. handsome, animal- loving psychologist said he would love to meet you.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Holy shit. Your brother didn't tell him about the nature of our relationship, did he?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: My brother is discreet.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Won't he be able to tell?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: My brother says the guy's a thirty- five year old virgin, so maybe he won't know how women usually feel. Plus he's got bad eyesight, almost legally blind, which is helpful in this situation. Plus he's got an extremely small penis, of which he is "mortifyingly ashamed", so chances are he'll be so grateful for any non- judgmental attention, that he'll be yours forever.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: God, he must be really close to your brother to tell him such personal stuff.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah, well my brother is his shrink.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I really like him, Rose. He's so...  ...passionate about his work.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: My brother says he likes you, too.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah. Says he likes you even more than he likes his own mother. And according to my brother Nathan's abormally close with his mother.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: My brother says things are going really well between you and Nathan.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I cannot believe how in love I am with this man.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: He's so cute. I even like his cute little penis. It's like a little pig's penis or something.  Rose, we connect on every level. I've finally found someone I can feel completely safe with.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Don't throw that away. I had that once with a guy. But I threw it away for a cheap thrill.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: One night stand?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No. I married a midget.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Marrying a midget was a cheap thrill?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well he wasn't really a midget. He was on the cusp of midgethood. That's what made it cheap. Had he been an actual midget, there would've been nothing cheap about it, my dear.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I didn't know you were into that sort of thing.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Let me tell you, honey, midgets are the best kept secret in male companionship. They're portable. They're controllable. They're eager. And they're exactly the right height for a little covert oral fun on the dance floor.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I have a friend you might like to meet.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Three foot one.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Be still my crotch.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Rose, Nathan's no midget, but he's asked me to move in with him.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah. My brother told me.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: And I think I'm going to.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Stand on a stepladder sometimes.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: No maid service! For God's sake, can't you read the fucking "do not disturb" sign on the fucking doorknob?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Lila, it's Rosie.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Go the fuck away, Rosie.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Please, honey, let me in.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Rose, please go away.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Lila, I want to help you.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: How'd you know where I was?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Nathan told my brother.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Your brother should have his license revoked.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah, although I'm not going to turn him in. I like hearing the dirt.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Why didn't your brother tell you that Nathan was having an affair?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I don't know, honey. I don't know. Maybe he just didn't want to get involved.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Oh, Rosie.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Let's get you out of here. Come stay with me until you get your strength back.  Free electrolysis, if you want it! We'll get that face of yours cleared up in no time.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Done!

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Ready!

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Uh, tie them up, Rosie. If you will.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: With pleasure.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm going to miss you.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Oh, Rosie.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: And I'm going to miss the lifestyle having you as a client has afforded me.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Shut up, you.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I like you so much, with or without hair.  But don't spread that around. Bad for business.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'm really glad you two found each other.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'll be in touch.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No you won't. But it's okay. You have stuff you gotta do.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Meditations on a Banana Slug was a delightful read.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Thank you so much. I love slugs. All slugs, not just banana slugs.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: As do I.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: They're so even keel. They forge ahead with slow determination. They don't get distracted or side-tracked. They don't care what they look like. They don't care that people look at them and go, "Ewww. A slug."

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: They don't seem to be especially ego driven, this is true.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You've got to respect that.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I have to say that I'm not there yet.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Slugdom. Sluggishness. Whatever you'd call it. I'm not there yet. I still have many human characteristics.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: That's not necessarily a bad thing.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Yes. I suppose not. But still. One would like to move along. To move beyond.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'm not sure we can escape our natures. Believe me I've tried. I'm not even so sure anymore that we should want to.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I love that you said that. It makes me feel a bit lighter. I've been rather heavy lately. Thinking about my childhood. Realizing how much a product I am of my upbringing.  I've been seeing someone. A therapist.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You are a therapist, right?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: No no. I'm a psychologist, but I do research. I'm a behaviorist. I work with animals. Mice at the moment.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I hope you don't perform any of those dreadful torture experiments, Nathan.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Heavens no. My work now is... Right now I'm teaching mice... well, table manners, to be candid.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: How's it going?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Quite well, really. It's a lot of work. A lot of reinforcement, mostly positive. Right now I've gotten two of my subjects to use napkins. Tiny napkins of course.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Paper or cloth?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I hope you don't think me daft. It's important work. It's part of a larger sociological experiment. I'm federally funded.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: What's the larger experiment?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: It's my thesis that if table manners can be taught to mice, they can be taught to humans.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Going out on a limb, aren't you, Nathan?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: The truth is most people don't have table manners today. And when the foundations of civilized society crumble and disappear, civilized society in its entirely follows closely at its heels.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Courtesy, decorum, manners, are all sadly lacking from our daily intercourse. Rudeness, vulgarity, meanness are the norm.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: We are animals after all.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Ergo if I can teach table manners to mice, I can teach them to humans. If I can teach table manners to humans, I can save the world.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: It looks wonderful.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: You look wonderful. I'm on top of the world tonight, Lila. Work is going splendidly and my personal life is ...

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Um-mmm. Oh Nathan, this salad is delish...

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: My God! The fork! The fork!

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'm sorry?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Tell her, Harold...  It's just that... It's nothing. It's just that the outside fork is the salad fork. One goes from the outside in as the dinner progresses.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I'm sorry, Nathan. I never really learned those things.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: No biggie.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Boy, this is good!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I'm sorry that I became so upset.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: No, I'm sorry. I'm really backward in certain areas.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: It's only that I really enjoy your company and...

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Yes, and...

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You really enjoy my company?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Yes.  Please don't talk with food in your mouth, Lila. Please. You're so pretty and it only mars your... I'm sorry. I'm being critical.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: It's just that I have some peculiarities, and...

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I like you, too, Nathan.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Yeah  But I have some peculiarities also.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I don't care. I don't care!  Like what, for example?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Actually, Mother and Father, you look very, very old. You look terrible.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Nathan!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: What are you doing in there?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'll be out in a minute.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I'm sorry about my parents.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You didn't seem sorry when you were laughing at all your mother's stupid, tasteless, cruel animal jokes.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I was simply attempting to keep the evening light. You know that I feel similarly to you about nature.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Of course.  I simply love the... naturalness of it all.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Do you? Oh do you, darling?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Why certainly!

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Oh, darling. I'm so relieved. Let's celebrate with a long hike in the woods tomorrow!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: That's a great idea.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: It'll be wonderful! I'll show you my old stomping grounds!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Terrific. Can't wait!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Shaving cream?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I don't think so.  Why?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Darling, did you bring the insect repellent lotion?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Yes, darling.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Oh, and the sun block?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: What SPF, sweetie?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Fifteen.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Perfectomundo! We are ready!  Say, wouldn't it be wonderful to have an insect repellent lotion that also worked as a sun block? Think of all the time one would save.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Yes, darling.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I think I'll get Johannsen in chemistry on that.  Oh! Did you bring the first aid kit?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Flares?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: We could call it "Quit Bugging Me, Sunny."  Get it? Sunny. S-u-n-n-y.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: That's very funny.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I love you so much.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Did you see that?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I don't know. Something.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: A deer?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: No. Too... upright. Might've been a person.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: It might behoove us to turn back at this point.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: If it's a person, why should we go see it? It's not like it's nature or anything. It's just a person.  Sometimes people who live in the woods don't want to be seen. They live in the woods because they're anti-social, Lila. We have to respect that.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: You'll catch cold. It's cold.  What do you suppose he is, a survivalist?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I think he's feral.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Feral? Don't touch him! He might be diseased! He might... My God, rabies!

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: He looks perfectly fine.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I think we should go. Please. Before he wakes up and, I don't know, eats us, or whatever feral things do.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I don't understand you. This is fascinating and you just want to run away. I mean, here we have a human being totally uncontaminated by civilization, totally free, and all you want to do is run back to your...

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Actually, I just had an amusing thought.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Feral, huh? Totally uncontaminated?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Look at him. He doesn't understand English. He moves like an animal.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: It's perfect!

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Nathan, what the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Forget mice! Actually forget guinea pigs, cats, monkeys, and chimps also. I'm on to stage five: The human subject.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Oh no. You can't take him from his home, Nathan.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Don't you see? He's my Tabula Rasa, my Eliza Dolittle. He's my ticket to the top of the Behaviorist food chain. He's going to make me famous.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I won't allow you. It's wrong. He's happy here.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Is he, Lila? Is he happy living filthy and naked alone in this tick infested wilderness? Never to know the love of a good woman, never to revel in the pitter-patter of little feet, never to read Moby Dick, or marvel at a Monet, or just sit back after a day of hard but rewarding work, smoke a pipe, and wonder about the nature of reality.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You'd be taking away his freedom, Nathan.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Freedom's just another word for nothing left to lose, Lila, to quote Janet Jackson.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: ...what is it that makes us human, if not the knowledge that we are indeed human? Think of this poor soul's education as the greatest gift we could bestow upon...

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Great. Grab his feet. We'll throw him in the trunk.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: What are you doing in there?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Nothing. Be right out.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Uh-huh. Right, Gabrielle. Right.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Absolutely, Gabrielle.  Someone from work!  Sorry about that, Gabrielle. Uh-huh. Exactly.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Who from work?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Excuse me one second, would you, Gabrielle?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: It's hormonal, Nathan. I can't help it. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Your entire body?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'm getting electrolysis. It's working, but it takes time. So meanwhile I have to...

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: You have to shave? Like an ape?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Apes don't shave, you son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Don't quibble. You know what I mean.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'm sorry. Please don't be mad at me for this.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Mad? I'm I'm... disgusted!

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I'm the same person I was before you knew, damn it! Oh God!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I have to think! I have to think!

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Was that okay? I mean, was I able to... satisfy you?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: You are an animal.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Really? Wow! That's that's terrific to hear from someone so... feminine, so female.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: I love being female because it, how do you say, allows me to be close to men.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: I'm glad you're female.  Do you think our boy witnessed the primal scene?

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: So, how's it going today?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Good. Making progress.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Honey, can we talk tonight? You know, about stuff? Things have been so strained for the past three weeks, since you know, and I just want to talk.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Everything's fine, honey. We don't need to talk. Besides I have to work late.

turns.speaker: LILA
turns.text: Please, Nathan. I really need this. You've been working late a lot.
